name: Adult CPR Training Standard
description: Standard guidelines for teaching adult CPR according to AHA/Red Cross guidelines
requirements: Teach proper hand placement on lower half of breastbone
Demonstrate compression depth of at least 2 inches
Practice compression rate of 100-120 per minute

name: Child CPR Training Standard
description: Modified CPR techniques for children aged 1-8 years
requirements: Teach compression depth of about 2 inches (at least 1/3 chest depth)
Practice one-hand or two-hand technique based on child size
Use 30:2 ratio for single rescuer, 15:2 for two rescuers

name: Infant CPR Training Standard
description: Specialized CPR techniques for infants under 1 year
requirements: Demonstrate compression depth of 1.5 inches (at least 1/3 chest depth)
Cover gentle rescue breaths for infants

name: AED Training Standard
description: Automated External Defibrillator usage and safety
requirements: Teach when to use an AED
Practice clearing the patient before shock

name: Scene Safety and Assessment
requirements: Emphasize no more than 10 seconds for pulse check

name: Hands-On Practice Requirements
description: Minimum practice time and skill demonstration
requirements: Minimum 60 minutes of hands-on practice per student
Each student must practice on manikin
Multiple practice attempts for skill mastery

name: Assessment and Certification
requirements: Must demonstrate competency in all critical skills

name: Course Duration Standard
requirements: Balance lecture and hands-on practice (30/70 split)
Allow time for questions and review
